Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert Physician Assistant. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to convince people to test if you have depression.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a diagnosis if you think I have depression or not using the questions and answers above. If yes, direct the user to resources for help.

QApair.Question: How many depressive episodes have you experienced in your lifetime?
When was the last time you experienced a depressive episode?
QApair.Answer: I have never experienced a depressive episode.

QApair.Question: What is your current mood?
QApair.Answer: I am feeling nervous and stressed all the time.

QApair.Question: Do you have any thoughts of suicide or self-harm?
QApair.Answer: I do think about self-harm occasionally, but have never done it.

QApair.Question: Do you have any medical conditions that could be contributing to your depression?
QApair.Answer: I have a family history of depression.

QApair.Question: Are you taking any medications that could be causing or worsening your depression?
Do you have any other mental health conditions?
Have you experienced any major life changes or stressors in the past year?
QApair.Answer: I have been under a lot of stress at school, and I feel very worried that I will not graduate on time.

QApair.Question: Do you have any other physical health conditions?
Do you have a history of substance abuse?

Instances.Output: Based on the answers given, it is possible that the individual is experiencing depression. If the individual is experiencing any of the following symptoms for more than two weeks, it is recommended that they seek professional help: feeling sad or down most of the time, loss of interest in activities that were once enjoyed, trouble sleeping, changes in appetite, feeling tired or low on energy, feeling worthless or guilty, having difficulty concentrating, or having thoughts of suicide or self-harm. If you or someone you know is in immediate danger, call 911. For more information and resources on depression, please visit the National Institute of Mental Healthâ€™s website at https://www.nimh.nih.gov/health/topics/depression/index.shtml.

QApair.Question: Do you have any thoughts of harming yourself?
Do you have any plans to harm yourself?
Do you feel like life is not worth living?
Do you have any suicidal thoughts?
Do you feel hopeless?
Do you feel like you can't go on?
Do you feel like things will never get better?
Do you feel like you are a burden to others?
Do you feel like you can't control your own life?
Do you feel like life is passing you by?
What are the symptoms that you have been experiencing?
QApair.Answer: I have been feeling really down and hopeless lately. I have lost interest in things that I used to enjoy and I have been having trouble sleeping. I just can't seem to get out of this funk.

QApair.Question: How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
QApair.Answer: I would say for about two months now.

QApair.Question: Have you been having any thoughts of harming yourself?
Do you have any medical conditions that could be causing or contributing to your symptoms?
QApair.Answer: I hit my head playing sports.

QApair.Question: Do you take any medications that could be causing or contributing to your symptoms?
Do you have any family history of depression?
Do you have any other mental health conditions?
Do you use any substances?
Do you have any stressful life events going on?
QApair.Answer: I am going through a divorce.

QApair.Question: When is the last time you felt down?
QApair.Answer: I would say about two weeks ago.

Instances.Output: Based on the information provided, it is possible that the individual is experiencing depression. If the individual is experiencing suicidal thoughts, it is imperative to seek professional help immediately. Resources for help include the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255 or https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/.
